channel.title: Comparison of compression tools for taking snapshots of Radix database
channel.description:
RadixPool is planning to host snapshots of the Radix node database on a Content Delivery Network (CDN) to allow Radix validator nodes to quickly recover from a corrupted database.
We compared a number of compression tools on a 43Gb copy of the Radix database and recorded the following results:
|Algorithm | Tool | Options |Compress | Size (bytes) | Decompress | 10Mbits/s | 50Mbit/s | 100Mbit/s| |-|-|-|-|-|-|-|-|-| |-|-|-|-|45,652,470,885|-|10h08m|2h01m|1h00m| |gzip|gzip||19m35s|25,009,428,317|3m50s|5h34m|1h07m|0h34m| |gzip|[pigz](https://zlib.net/pigz/)||2m32s|24,962,921,223|1m58s|5h33m|1h07m|0h34m| |gzip|[pigz](https://zlib.net/pigz/)|`--best`|6m37s|24,932,450,560|2m10s|5h32m|1h07m|0h34m| |xz|[pixz](https://github.com/vasi/pixz)||21m33s|21,702,409,016|1m38s|4h49m|0h57m|0h28m| |xz|[pixz](https://github.com/vasi/pixz)|`-9 -p8`|42m58s|21,412,039,372|1m39s|4h45m|0h57m|0h28m| |7z|[7z](https://www.7-zip.org/)||20m50s|21,683,532,361|16m15s|4h49m|0h57m|0h28m| |7z|[7z](https://www.7-zip.org/)|`-m0=lzma2 -mx`|35m57s|21,367,916,757|16m01s|4h44m|0h56m|0h28m| |zstd|[zstd](https://facebook.github.io/zstd/)|`--fast=1`|1m26s|24,062,687,524|1m13s|5h20m|1h04m|0h32m| |zstd|[zstd](https://facebook.github.io/zstd/)||2m53s|23,032,636,843|1m23s|5h07m|1h01m|0h30m| |zstd|[zstd](https://facebook.github.io/zstd/)|`--long`|4m53s|22,743,480,552|1m26s|5h03m|1h00m|0h30m| |zstd|[zstd](https://facebook.github.io/zstd/)|`-19 -T8`|39m25s|21,999,437,864|1m32s|4h53m|0h58m|0h29m|
### Results
The xz algorithm was selected for Radix database compression for it's high compression ratio and fast decompression speed. xz has binaries for Linux and Windows.
### Not Tested: * [lzip](https://www.nongnu.org/lzip/plzip.html) * [bzip2](https://sourceware.org/bzip2/) * [lz4](https://lz4.github.io/lz4/)
